sentences.sContent: Kylie feels fortunate to be in such a privileged position because of her successful TV career.
sentences.sCn: 凯莉觉得由于成功的电视生涯而使自己处于这样优越的地位真是幸运。

sentences.sContent: ...possible only for a privileged class — the same that produced gentlemen scientists...
...they have come to perceive their privileged positions essentially as a natural right...
...usually a result of coming from a more privileged background...
...But more privileged students must not waste this opportunity either...

remMethod.val: priv(单个) ＋ i ＋ leg(法律) ＋ e → 法律上的独享权利 → 特权

trans.tranOther: having a special advantage or a chance to do something that most people cannot do
